intro: Psilocarphus tenuis, commonly known as the slender psilocarphus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
